Complex partial seizures are probably the most common type of seizures in adult.
They are essentially staring spells or periods with impaired responsiveness.
Sometimes other individuals don't recognize them.
They think the person is just taking a moment to themselves.
They typically last 20 seconds to a few minutes.
There's no loss of consciousness, no falling, but some mild confusion.
There may be partial responsiveness or no responsiveness.
And it is a very significant problem because as an adult, you can't drive with these seizures, and they can also affect employment.
